sessions.session_summary: Two co-workers enjoy enjoying the scenery outside while working. They notice new places and plan to check out new ones.
sessions.session_text:
It's such a beautiful day outside. Look at all the people walking by!
Yeah, but at least we have a nice view from our office.
I feel like I always notice something new when I look out the window. Like that new cafe that just opened up across the street.
That's a great idea! We should definitely plan a lunch date soon.
Oh yeah, I loved their salmon rolls. They were so good.

sessions.session_summary: Co-worker A tells Co-worker B they are pregnant and expresses anxiety about telling others. Co-worker B offers to take Co-worker A's project submissions and offers to take Co-worker A's report.
sessions.session_text:
Can I trust you with a secret?
I'm pregnant!
Thank you, I'm so excited but also a bit nervous.
I hope so. It's just scary because it's my first child and I don't know what to expect.
Not really, I wanted to tell someone at work first just to have someone to confide in.
Not yet, I'm waiting for the right time. But I wanted to tell you first.
Thank you, that means a lot to me.
I'll definitely take you up on that. And I'm sorry to change the subject, but have you finished working on that project from last week?
Actually, I might need some help with the report due next week. Would you be able to take a look at it with me?
That would be perfect, thank you. And again, thank you for being a great friend.

sessions.session_summary: Co-worker A received positive feedback from the hiring manager about their application and is excited for Co-worker B's role. Co-worker B expresses support but Co-worker A misses Co-worker B's presence and Co-worker A expresses their desire to meet the little one.
sessions.session_text:
Did you hear back from the hiring manager about my application?
That's great news! I can't wait to start.
Thanks, I really appreciate your support. I'm going to miss working with you, though.
Of course! And who knows, maybe we'll work together again in the future.
I'm feeling good, still a little tired sometimes. And no major updates yet, just taking it one day at a time.

sessions.session_summary: Co-worker A hurt Co-worker B by being truthful with them about their past relationship. Co-worker B apologizes and expresses concern about Co-worker A's past hurtful behavior. Co-worker A expresses willingness to forgive Co-worker B and offer forgiveness.
sessions.session_text:
I need to talk to you about something that I've been feeling guilty about.
Remember when we started seeing each other?
Well, I wasn't entirely truthful with you. I led you to believe that I was interested in being in a relationship with you, when in reality I only wanted to use you for sex.
I know, and I'm so sorry. It was wrong of me, and I had no right to treat you that way. I was going through a rough time and I didn't know how to handle it.
I understand how you feel, and I'm willing to do anything to make it up to you. I know I can't change the past, but I hope we can work towards building back some kind of friendship or at least some level of trust.
I understand. Is there anything I can do to make it right?
Of course, take all the time you need. And again, I'm so sorry for hurting you like this.
I know. And please know that I'm willing to do whatever it takes to make things right between us.

sessions.session_summary: Co-worker A complains about their coffee being too cold and blames the cafeteria staff for not listening. Co-worker B suggests meal prepping and reminds them that it's okay to apologize for hurting them. They also discuss past mistakes and how open communication can help them move forward.
sessions.session_text:
Ugh, my coffee is always too cold! Why can't they just get it right?
Of course I have! But they just don't listen. And don't even get me started on the food in the cafeteria.
It's always either undercooked or overcooked. I can't even enjoy my lunch break anymore because of it.
I have, but I don't have time to prepare anything in the morning. I'm always rushing out the door.
I guess that's a good idea. But honestly, I just feel like everything is so hard lately.
It's just this job. It's so demanding and I feel like I'm always falling behind.
Yeah, I guess you're right. But I still feel like I'm not good enough.
I know, but it's hard to admit when I'm struggling. I don't want people to think I'm not capable.
Thanks, I really appreciate that. You're a good friend.
Yeah, I do. That was such an exciting time.
I know, right? Life is unpredictable like that.
â€¦Yeah, I remember. I'm sorry for hurting you like that. It was a mistake and I regret it every day.
I have, I promise. I've grown a lot since then and I know how important it is to be honest with people.
Me too. It feels good to have closure on that chapter of our lives.
